bugs.description:
Possible crash in error-handling logic. The code uses `err instanceof mongoose.mongo.MongoWriteConcernError` (e.g. in test/util.js line 23) without first confirming that `mongoose.mongo.MongoWriteConcernError` is defined and callable. If the MongoDB driver version being used does not define this class, `instanceof undefined` will throw a `TypeError`, causing the helper to fail while processing an error.

Safer pattern:
```
if (typeof mongoose.mongo.MongoWriteConcernError === 'function' &&
    err instanceof mongoose.mongo.MongoWriteConcernError &&
    /operation was interrupted/.test(err.message)) {
  ...
}
```
